snippet: Police will no longer file charges against people who display small amounts of marijuana in public, though that has not helped Anthony Welfare, who lost his job in August over a misdemeanor.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column notes that although city's shift on marijuana policy is welcome, it comes too late to help some; cites case of former school bus driver Anthony Welfare, who lost his job after being charged with misdemeanor for displaying small amount of marijuana, action that would now be considered mere violation.
lead_paragraph: Police will no longer file charges against people who display small amounts of marijuana in public, though that has not helped Anthony Welfare, who lost his job in August over a misdemeanor.

headline.main: Shift on Marijuana Policy Was a Long Time Coming, and Too Late for One Man
headline.print_headline: Shift on Marijuana Policy Was a Long Time Coming, and Too Late for One Man
